ATTRIBUTED.Definition: considered to have been said by

FRAGMENTED.Definition: broken into many small parts or groups

COMMON GROUND.Definition: ideas or opinions that different people shared

UNWORKABLE.Definition: not possible to make happen or succeed

COALITION.Definition: a group of different parties or people who would work together

CONTINUITY.Definition: keeping things the same over time

IN BROAD DAYLIGHT.Definition: during the day when everyone could see

VERDICT.Definition: final decision or judgement about it

OMITTING.Definition: leaving out or not including it

CONVOY.Definition: the group of vehicles moving together

BODYGUARDS.Definition: people whose job was to protect him

BUNDLED.Definition: pushed or pulled quickly and roughly

CHILLING.Definition: making you feel afraid or shocked

CELLS.Definition: small secret groups within the larger organisation

BEGGED.Definition: asked strongly and emotionally for it

PLEADING.Definition: asking in an emotional or desperate way

ABANDONED.Definition: left alone or given up on

PENSIONERS.Definition: people who no longer worked and got money from the government

BOW TO.Definition: give in to, accept their demands

ABSTRACT.Definition: not real or clear; more like an idea

KIDNAPPERS.Definition: people who had taken him away by force

KIDNAPPING.Definition: the act of taking him away by force

ACCORDINGLY.Definition: in a way that was appropriate to the particular circumstances

RESOLUTE.Definition: firm and not changing their mind

BOOT.Definition: the back part of the car where luggage was kept

CRUELTY.Definition: being unkind or causing pain on purpose

CONDEMNED.Definition: said strongly that it was wrong or bad

FUNERAL.Definition: a ceremony for burying his body

TRIAL.Definition: a formal examination to decide if he was guilty

HUMILIATING.Definition: making them feel very embarrassed or ashamed

SAGA.Definition: long story with many events or problems

DENOUNCED.Definition: said publicly that they were bad or wrong
